title: After receiving new information, International House of Prayer in Kansas City announces separation from founder Mike Bickle
text:
IHOPKC has formally separated from its founder Mike Bickle.
The International House of Prayer in Kansas City announced Friday night that it has separated from founder Mike Bickle.
Spokesperson Eric Volz, in a statement, said the separation is happening “immediately, formally, and permanently” after the committee received “new information to now confirm a level of inappropriate behavior.”

IHOPKC Executive Director Stuart Greaves also resigned.
According to Volz, Kurt Fuller, who took over the management of the crisis on Dec. 10, will take over the executive director duties.
You can watch the full statement here:
KMBC 9 has been following the allegations against Bickle since October.
Bickle was placed on leave from the ministry after three former senior leaders accused him of sexual abuse.
No criminal charges have been filed in the case.
Bickle released a statement earlier this month, saying, “I sadly admit that 20-plus years ago, I sinned by engaging in inappropriate behavior —my moral failures were real. I am not admitting to the more intense sexual activities that some are suggesting.”
You can read Bickle’s full statement here:
A third party investigation will continue.
